summary: Jerome A. Cullings was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). He appears in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents list his name, salary, and pay during the specified periods. The documents do not provide any specific details about his role or responsibilities within the SCAS, only that he was an employee during that time.
significance: Jerome A. Cullings' significance in the JFK context is limited to his employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. The documents suggest he was a staff member during the committee's investigation, but his specific role and contributions are not detailed.
